basics.name: Dan Martin
basics.label: Full Stack Developer
basics.summary: I am a Full Stack Developer with over 17 years experience in industry. I have experience with several popular languages, libraries and frameworks such as Laravel, PHP, AngularJS, VueJS, JavaScript, JQuery, Bootstrap, HTML/CSS, and Python along with some iOS development experience.

work.summary: Developing, enhancing and maintaining of key applications. Converting applications over from legacy Java applications to Laravel / AngularJS applications. Maintaining code repositories, providing code reviews of junior and senior developers to ensure application integrity and usability.
highlights: Developed and implemented robust architecture systems
Designed and developed API for mobile offerings
Formulated technical specifications by translation of product needs
Utilized enterprise design frameworks and patterns for web development

work.summary: Creation of website, Point of Sale, internal messaging system, blog and default systems manager.
highlights: Used Javascript. jQuery to build front-end client interaction, dynamic interfaces, and visual animations.
Programmed all code by hand to be extremely modular and lightweight.
Utilized Object-Oriented Programming and Model View Controller methodology.
Used PHP, MySQL, and AJAX (w/ JSON) to serve and save content for websites
Used HTML5 to create flexible and semantic website markup.
Used SASS & Compass preprocessing to create pixel-perfect CSS3 website designs.

work.summary: Creation and maintenance of many Web sites and applications for corporate, non-profit and other clients. Performed the full spectrum of Web-related tasks, including rapid prototyping, design and layout, graphics creation and optimization, server-side programming (primarily PHP), MySQL databases, AJAX interactivity, standards-compliant XHTML and CSS, testing, training, hosting, security, traffic generation and ongoing updates.
highlights: Creation of custom branded content management system to allow for client entries to be validated to W3C standard specifications, with reduced markup.
Used PHP, MySQL, HTML4, and CSS2 to create online course websites

work.summary: Created website www.tdn.com , and content management system to allow daily updates for newsroom and copy desk. Built intranet system for in-house communication, and filing systems.
highlights: Utilized Cold Fusion for first iteration of website and CMS
Utilized PHP for second iteration of website and CMS
